source:
west ham are discussing a deal for jamaican starlet deshane beckford after he impressed on trial .
the skilful 17-year-old forward from montego bay united was invited to train with west ham 's academy earlier this month and has impressed coaches after spending two weeks with the club .
beckford also has offers from clubs in belgium .
beckford , who has been linked with a host of european clubs , is said to be one of the hottest prospects to emerge from the caribbean .
premier league outfit west ham are closing in on the signature of jamaican starlet deshane beckford
meanwhile , west ham have revealed season tickets at the olympic stadium will cost as little as £ 289 .
the hammers will have the cheapest pricing strategy in the barclays premier league in a bid to fill the 54,000 capacity stadium when they make the switch for the 2016-17 season .
summary: West Ham United is in discussions to sign 17-year-old Jamaican forward Deshane Beckford, who impressed during a two-week trial with their academy. Beckford, from Montego Bay United, has also received offers from Belgian clubs and is considered one of the hottest prospects to emerge from the Caribbean. Additionally, West Ham has announced that season tickets for their Olympic Stadium will cost as little as £289 for the 2016-17 season, making it the cheapest pricing strategy in the Barclays Premier League.

West Ham is in talks to sign Jamaican starlet Deshane Beckford, who impressed during a trial. Beckford, a 17-year-old forward from Montego Bay United, trained with West Ham's academy and received positive feedback from coaches. He also has offers from Belgian clubs. West Ham aims to secure Beckford's signature, and they have announced affordable season tickets at the Olympic Stadium, priced as low as £289, to attract fans for the 2016-17 Premier League season.

summary:
Here's a concise summary of the passage:

West Ham United are in talks to sign 17-year-old Jamaican forward Deshane Beckford from Montego Bay United. Beckford recently impressed during a two-week trial with West Ham's academy. He is considered a top prospect from the Caribbean and has attracted interest from other European clubs, including some in Belgium. Separately, West Ham announced that season tickets for their new Olympic Stadium will start at £289, making them the cheapest in the Premier League. This pricing strategy aims to fill the 54,000-seat stadium when the team moves there for the 2016-17 season.
